urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
They drain our chalk streams dry, dump over 3.1 million hours worth of sewage into our rivers and now this.

The water industry is the UKs' largest source of micro plastic pollution in rivers.

So much for regulation then. @Defra @Ofwat @EnvAgency 

https://t.co/Sb77dX1RmG

We do NOT give consent to being invaded by landfill gases. STOP assaulting us daily @RedIndustries2 and stop allowing them to @EnvAgency @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe #stopthestink https://t.co/thyoNcVHoZ
No wonder the river is in trouble @EnvAgency @timthefruit @EMorfett @HelenStace_HWT https://t.co/qp10kXXuQu

urls.title: Water firms are main source of microplastics in UK rivers, study says
urls.description: Research says discharge of untreated sewage and wastewater during dry spells to blame

tweets.text:
Important new research out today by @Jamie_Woodward_ & others identifies water firms as the main source of microplastics in UK rivers. 

Builds more pressure on government @EnvAgency to tackle the way water firms release untreated effluent into our rivers.
https://t.co/HKK1Ar0abP

@SianieRoo @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice Well said @SianieRoo  @ClareDinnisEA  minimising the truth IT‚ÄôS NOXIOUS GAS that has an odour

@EnvAgencyMids To be crystal clear @ClareDinnisEA As if you didn‚Äôt know - this is NOT just an odour! Stop gaslighting the health effects from a toxic gas!! @Cap_it_off #stopthestink @StinkStopthe @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice
@EnvAgencyMids Why are you giving them further actions while we continue to be gassed in our homes? They have not solved the problem, shut it down #stopthestink

@Gwynthegriff @ChrisGPackham @EnvAgency @ClintonDevon @kiergroup @NESouthWest @WiseBirding I wrote both - the dance article was a freelance commission for which I was not paid; the grief article was about solastalgia - the loss of a place (specifically Jones Hill Wood) and climate grief, as well as personal loss.
Our  volunteers in the LDV with the litter and debris they cleared from the area around Sanderson's weir in Sheffield this week @LDVFlood @EnvAgencyYNE @SheffCouncil https://t.co/xKubW3KxNb

@EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency @EssexWildlife Priorities @EnvAgency? Signal crayfish are invasive and damaging. What we want you to tackle is the #sewage #pollution the water companies are pouring into our waterways!

tweets.text: Just thinking about all you poor people living through the nightmare of Walleys Quarry landfill and the people here who are living closest to Mullaghglass and the effects on mental health. We will get clean air! üíñ  @StinkStopthe @Mullaghglass123 #MentalHealthAwarenessWeek

.@NaturalEngland‚Äôs research shows that people who visit nature at least once a week are nearly twice as likely to say that their lives are worthwhile than those with low nature connectedness 

Read more here: https://t.co/XSS9SeTx5H

@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency "Safely" connect with nature?
What on earth does that mean?
@JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency Not having to deal with the @EnvAgency would improve my mental health.

üåç We‚Äôve published the #FCERMStrategy Action Plan. 

It sets out the steps we‚Äôll take to create climate resilient places and to prepare our nation for the future.

#TogetherForOurPlanet #COP26 @The_WMA https://t.co/yeTB8Isl0C

Organised crime networks are stealing car parts for their precious metals.

Working with the British Transport Police, the Joint Unit for Waste Crime recovered over 1,000 stolen catalytic converters and arrested over 50 people in April.

Read more: https://t.co/bmOkpZsYDM

@BTP https://t.co/Cbyioiyc6d

Attended 17 Scrap Metal sites across the Birmingham  area with @BTP and @johncurtinEA, part of a nationwide effort to tackle catalytic converter and other metal theft. 
Advice given at some sites, others will be subject to further investigations in conjunction with police https://t.co/UbAMC9gNW4

26 & 24mins in 
https://t.co/9gIAX8IEJP
@HS2ltd & the @EnvAgency really don't understand water goes downhill & chalk is fragile & porous!

Very good question from the convicted criminal authorised by the ‚Å¶@EnvAgency‚Å© to operate a high risk business like a landfill @capitoff @stinkstopthe ‚Å¶@MattHancock‚Å© ‚Å¶@Georgeeustice @defra #stopthestink https://t.co/Cvw6zTIUgg

@Malvernmeet @stushurlock @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency We all have a responsibility to reduce plastic waste - absolutely. We also need to rethink urban drainage and increase green spaces to reduce runoff and take pressure off the sewer system. Dumping untreated wastewater into rivers during low flows is not acceptable.

@Jamie_Woodward_ @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency I accept that. I too think that it's ludicrous that these untreated overflows are allowed at all.

The basic problem is the cheap way we have always built sewerage systems. The old combined systems are a well-known problem but overflows occur on supposed separate systems too. 1/2

@stushurlock @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency No that is quite wrong. Conventional treatment will remove well over 90% of the microplastic load. This is well known. We are just asking them to treat the waste. Nothing more.

@hayulls @Lucy_Lapwing @LGSpace @Buzz_dont_tweet @DandelionAppre1 @Love_plants @wildflower_hour @WildFlowerSoc @BiodiversitySoS @MeadowInGarden @DaveGoulson @RewildingB A too common sight around #Banbury and in a play area too. Children should be exposed to Daisies and Dandelions not toxic herbicides @banburyfm @banburynews @Cherwellcouncil @TownEvents @EnvAgency https://t.co/trPXmKhNrN

@SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe Why is this company allowed to get away with all of this!!!  Shut it down now before we are left to pick another 5 years if their inept, corrupt, poisonous activities. For them to then walk away and leave us with the tab having taken their billions in profits.
